Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior in handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of part of battle scene to right (from left, nose, neck, and chest of bridled horse; draped figure holding spear or staff upright in left hand, wearing added red chiton, and black himation with added white flecks; warrior striding out, right arm raised holding lost spear; he has red beard, white helmet crest, short chiton decorated at hem, greave, shield with red on rim and perhaps baldric; two ancient repair holes, one on either side of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Unmarked, found in drawer labelled 'mainly Naukratis.'
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0505) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
